First, we observe that
$$ \cot^{-1}\left(\frac{1+k(k+1)x^2}{x}\right) = \tan^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{1+k(k+1)x^2}\right) = \tan^{-1}\left(\frac{(k+1)x - kx}{1 + (kx)((k+1)x)}\right) = \tan^{-1}((k+1)x) - \tan^{-1}(kx) $$

(B) We have $S_n(x) = \tan^{-1}((n+1)x) - \tan^{-1}(x)$. Then
$$ \cot(S_n(x)) = \cot(\tan^{-1}((n+1)x) - \tan^{-1}(x)) = \cot(\tan^{-1}\left(\frac{(n+1)x - x}{1+(n+1)x \cdot x}\right)) = \cot\left(\tan^{-1}\left(\frac{nx}{1+(n+1)x^2}\right)\right) = \frac{1+(n+1)x^2}{nx} = \frac{1}{nx} + \frac{(n+1)x}{n} $$

Thus, statement (B) is true.

Therefore, the equation $4x^2 - 3x + 1 = 0$ has no real roots, and thus $S_3(x) = \frac{\pi}{4}$ has no root in $(0, \infty)$. Thus, statement (C) is false.
